Class AlarmClock

  • java.lang.Object
    • AlarmClock

  • public class AlarmClock
extends java.lang.Object
    The AlarmClock class creates an alarm clock for a standard 12 hour clock. The alarm clock will display the clock time, along with the alarm time. If the clock time matches with the alarm time, the alarm will ring. The ringing is simulated by outputting "RING RING RING" to the console (via System.out.println()).
    Version:
    2017.09.22
    Author:
    Christophe Tran

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlarmClock

        public AlarmClock()
        Constructor for objects of class AlarmClock. This constructor creates a clock set to 12:00a.m and an alarm set to 12:00a.m with the alarm turned off.

      • AlarmClock

        public AlarmClock(int clockHour,
                  int clockMin,
                  java.lang.String clockAmPm,
                  int alarmHour,
                  int alarmMin,
                  java.lang.String alarmAmPm,
                  java.lang.Boolean alarmState)
        Constructor for objects of class AlarmClock. This constructor creates a clock and alarm set to the time specified in the parameters along with whether the alarm is on or off.
        Parameters:
        clockHour - Hour of the clock
        clockMin - Minute of the clock
        clockAmPm - a.m or p.m for the clock
        alarmHour - Hour of the alarm
        alarmMin - Minute of the alarm
        alarmAmPm - a.m or p.m for the alarm
        alarmState - Whether the alarm is on or off

    • Method Detail

      • clockTick

        public void clockTick()
        Makes the clock display go one minute forward. If the clock time matches the alarm time, the alarm will ring and then be turned off.

      • getAlarmTime

        public java.lang.String getAlarmTime()
        Returns the time of the alarm in the format HH:MM.
        Returns:
        The current time of the alarm

      • getTime

        public java.lang.String getTime()
        Returns the current time of the clock in the format HH:MM.
        Returns:
        The current time of the clock

      • isAlarmSet

        public java.lang.Boolean isAlarmSet()
        Checks if the alarm is turned on or not.
        Returns:
        true if alarm is turned on, false otherwise

      • setAlarm

        public void setAlarm()
        Turns the alarm of the alarm clock on.

        Set the time of the alarm to the time specified in the parameters.
        Parameters:

        minute - The minute of the alarm
        timeState - a.m or p.m for the alarm
